message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++){
                JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
                Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
                while (keys.hasNext()) {
                    String key = keys.next();
                    String value = jsonObject.getString(key);
                    System.out.println(key + value);
                }
            }
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Iterator to iterate over the keys of each JSONObject in the JSONArray. Then, you can use the key to get the corresponding value from the JSONObject.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++){
   JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
   Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
   while(keys.hasNext()){
      String key = keys.next();
      String value = jsonObject.getString(key);
      System.out.println(key + value);
   }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the JSONObject.keys() method to get an iterator over the keys of the JSON object. Then, you can use the Iterator.next() method to get each key, and use the JSONObject.getString() method to get the corresponding value.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++){
    JSONObject obj = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
    Iterator<String> keys = obj.keys();
    while(keys.hasNext()){
        String key = keys.next();
        String value = obj.getString(key);
        System.out.println(key + value);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the keys() method of the JSONObject to get an Iterator of all the keys in the object. Then, you can iterate over the keys and use getString(key) to get the corresponding value.
